title: Font identification from sign
content:
Hello, I need help identifying the font used on this sign or something very close.

[https://img1.etsystatic.com/000/0/5376547/il\_570xN.149010105.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174406/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fimg1.etsystatic.com/000/0/5376547/il_570xN.149010105.jpg)

Font: 

 Birmingham Titling 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174406/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [il\_570xN.149010105.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174406/http:/typophile.com/files/il_570xN.149010105.jpg) | 27.12 KB |
author: strandedpirate

comments.content: It looks like a combination of **[Birmingham Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174406/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=BirminghamBold%20-%20Regular&fid=88b8047e69995419a884d5678dccbc89&fsize=60&text=BEACH%20ACCESS&fit=1)** and **[Birmingham Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174406/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=BirminghamTitling%20-%20Regular&fid=64349c0133f67c6e2c3e43d5fdf8a2c1&fsize=60&text=BEACH%20ACCESS&fit=1)** free fonts by PJ Lloyd [1995] + the required deformation for the "BEACH"
Wow, that font is ridiculously close. I'm rolling with it. Thanks!
